newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Radio Pacific buys Auckland Kool station.
newsitem.headline: Radio Pacific buys Auckland Kool station.

text.p: Radio Pacific network said on Thursday it had bought the Auckland Frequency 93.4FM which broadcasts a programme branded KOOL FM.

The company told shareholders the consolidated result for the first quarter of the current year, April to June, was online with forecast earnings, but forward sales for the Radio Pacific network were considerably lower than at this time last year.
This was caused in part by the fact that the company was working through the process of transferring responsibility for selling Radio Pacific in the North Island regions to the Energy stations.

Some revenue that in past years contributed to Radio Pacific's earnings would now flow through Energy Enterprises accounts. But Pacific was also at the receiving end of some of the economic gloom that currently prevails, the company said.
